abstract: James Dimon, the head of the banking giant JPMorgan Chase, recently estimated that the credit crunch was about 75 percent over. But Meredith Whitney, the head of equity research at Oppenheimer, believes that it will extend well into 2009 and perhaps beyond that.
lead_paragraph: James Dimon, the head of the banking giant JPMorgan Chase, recently estimated that the credit crunch was about 75 percent over. But Meredith Whitney, the head of equity research at Oppenheimer, believes that it will extend well into 2009 and perhaps beyond that.

headline.main: Analyst Sees More Pain Ahead for Banks
